title.narrative: OUTPUT 25: INCLUSIVE DEVELOPMENT

description.narrative: Research, dialogue and strategies effectively promote inclusive development in national and sectoral policy frameworks, which contributes to Reducing Child Poverty, Reducing Child Poverty (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, poor children benefit from inclusive development being a central objective of national and sectoral policies

sector.narrative: Child poverty measurement: support to routine national measurement of monetary and multidimensional child poverty

Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Technical assistance - Child poverty, Public Finance and Local Governance

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Research, dialogue and strategies effectively promote inclusive development in national and sectoral policy frameworks

description.narrative: Concepts and policy recommendations around child poverty, child responsive inclusive growth and the impact of COVID-19 on children were integrated into the capacity building and policy review and proposal discussions processes of government and its stakeholders towards the formulation of the forthcoming Medium-Term National Development Policy Framework.As a result, the Zero Draft MTNDPF has made significant references to health and nutrition, child protection, social protection, WASH, poverty (including child poverty), persons with disabilities (including children), education, COVID-19 and inclusive development in several sectors. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:05/01/2022
